meanings.definition: A shelter made of blocks of snow or ice.
meanings.sent1: During the winter storm, we built an agloo to protect ourselves from the cold.
meanings.sent2: The Inuit people are skilled at constructing agloos for temporary shelter.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended their snow fort was an agloo fit for a snow queen.
meanings.sent4: The agloo stood tall and proud, a fortress of ice in the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering agloo glistened in the sunlight, a beacon of survival in the frozen wilderness.

meanings.definition: To build a shelter out of blocks of snow or ice.
meanings.sent1: We decided to agloo near the ski resort to have a cozy place to rest.
meanings.sent2: In survival training, they teach you how to agloo in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent3: The family planned to agloo together, bonding over the shared task of building a shelter.
meanings.sent4: She had to agloo quickly before the blizzard hit, gathering snow blocks for protection.
meanings.sent5: As the snow piled up, they began to agloo, creating a safe haven in the icy wilderness.
